description:

Summary
The Mechanical Technologist will assist in the development and production of construction drawings utilizing REVIT and AutoCAD. The successful individual will have in-depth working knowledge and understanding of the construction industry, building systems, national, provincial, and local building codes, and by-laws. 
Key Responsibilities
- Create engineering drawings for process and industrial building mechanical systems (plumbing, piping, HVAC, refrigeration) using computer-aided-design (CAD) and building-information-modeling (BIM) software.- Preparation and review of contract administration documentation.- Generate CAD and REVIT content to advance company standards.- Collaborate with clients, engineers, project managers, and trades to ensure client satisfaction and the achievement of project deliverables as required.- Perform site visits to assess existing conditions of mechanical systems.- Select appropriate mechanical equipment and plumbing fixtures as required for each project design including the sizing of piping and HVAC systems.- Provide written reports and logs as required.
Essential Skills and Qualifications
- Intermediate user of AutoCAD and REVIT (a portfolio of previous REVIT projects is required).- Solid understanding of applicable Ontario building codes and specifications.- Extensive knowledge and ability in the production of mechanical drawings and documents.- Must have own transportation and a willingness to travel.
Education and Experience
- Completion of a College or University diploma or degree in Mechanical Engineering.- Minimum of two (2) years experience in a computer-aided drafting setting with a focus on mechanical engineering.- Drafting and related computer skills appropriate within industrial design is considered an asset.- Certified or working towards certification with a provincial professional association for engineering technicians and technologists, such as OACETT.- Previous hydronics experience is considered an asset.- Previous experience in the Agri-food, beverage, and/or pharmaceutical industries is considered an asset.
Successful candidates will demonstrate:
- Initiative and judgment in applying standard procedures and in problem solving.- Ability to deal with multiple tasks and conflicting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.- Strong customer service skills including presenting ideas and the ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.- Understanding and ability of mechanical engineering principles and procedures.- Excellent organizational skills and strong attention to detail.- Proficiency in performing key responsibilities with minimal direction and oversight.- Willingness to learn and train those in need.- Ability to work in a high‐performance environment, deal with customers in a professional manner, and willingness to travel primarily within Ontario if required for projects.
